str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'loosen'.
Much, many; often.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To reverence, worship, adore. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to revere, i.e. Adore.
From the alternate of proserchomai; an arriver from a foreign region, i.e., an acceder to Judaism.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To speak to, converse with. From pros and laleo; to talk to, i.e. Converse with.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pros and meno; to stay further, i.e. Remain in a place, with a person; figuratively, to adhere to, persevere in.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
